00017 ImportanceSamplingController::ImportanceSamplingController(Controller* controller, Teacher* teacher, int outputDim)
00018     : TransformController(controller) {
00019     this->teacher = teacher;
00020     isTeaching = true;
00021     
00022     distribution.resize(outputDim);
00023     teacherDistribution.resize(outputDim);
00024     teacherController = new BasicController(teacher);
00025 
00026     K = 0.0;
00027     kSamp = 0;
00028     Ka = 0;
00029     whichIS = noIS;
00030 
00031 }
00032     
00033 
00034 ImportanceSamplingController::~ImportanceSamplingController() {
00035     delete teacherController;
00036 }

00038 
00042 void ImportanceSamplingController::getAction(Observation& obs, Vector& action, bool computeGrad) {
00043 
00044     if (! isTeaching) {
00045         // If not observing the teacher, just call the embedded
00046         // controller's getAction() method.
00047         
00048         
00049         controller->getAction(obs, action, computeGrad);
00050         
00051         
00052     } else {
00053         /* If observing the teacher: go through the controller's and
00054          * the teacher's getAction() methods, so as to compute their
00055          * probability distributions over actions.
00056          * (plus the gradient for the controller)
00057          */
00058         
00059         /* 1- Get the distribution produced by the controller,
00060          * test if there is an eligible action,
00061          * and clean it if a NaN appears.
00062          */
00063         
00064         // [daa] don't compute the gradient yet, it's the wrong action
00065         
00066         controller->getAction(obs, action, false);
00067         
00068         distribution.clear();
00069         controller->reduce(distribution, Approximator::DIST);
00070         
00071         Vector distController = distribution;
00072         
00073         
00074         //cout.flush(); cerr.flush();
00075         
00076         /* 2- Compute the teacher's distribution. Don't attempt to compute gradients
00077          */
00078         teacherController->getAction(obs, action, false);
00079         teacherController->reduce(teacherDistribution, Approximator::DIST);
00080         /* 3- Use these two distributions to compute the distribution to sample from.
00081          */
00082         if (action[0] != -1) {
00083             distribution *= (1. - tRate);
00084             distribution += tRate*teacherDistribution;
00085         } else {
00086             // Distribution is unchanged.. equals the distController, so K=1
00087         }
00088         /*cerr<<"dist(controller+teacher)="<<distribution<<endl;*/
00089         assert(fabs(norm_1(distribution) - 1.0) < 0.00001);
00090 
00091         /* 4- Pick an action
00092          */
00093         
00094         int sampledAct  = Sampler::discrete(distribution, 1.0);
00095         
00096         action[0] = sampledAct;
00097         
00098         
00099         //cout<<"Action picked="<<action[0]<<endl;
00100         
00101         // Update the importance coefficient.
00102         if ( distController[sampledAct]==0 ||
00103              !isnormal(distController[sampledAct]) // Is it a normal floating point number?
00104              ) {
00105             cout<<"K="<<K<<endl;
00106             cout<<"Action picked="<<action[0]<<endl;
00107             cout<<distController[sampledAct]<<"/"<<distribution[sampledAct]<<"/";
00108             cout<<obs.getEligible()[sampledAct]<<endl;
00109             cout<<"dist(controller)="<<distController<<endl;
00110             cout<<"dist(controller+teacher)="<<distribution<<endl;
00111             exit(0);
00112         }
00113         
00114         double k = 0; 
00115         
00116         /* 5- Do the importance sampling re-weighting of the eligibility trace.
00117          */
00118         switch (whichIS) {
00119         case noIS:
00120             break;
00121         case weightedLocalIS:
00122             // [daa] Now that we have settled on an action, compute
00123             // the gradient and feedback
00124             k = distController[sampledAct] / distribution[sampledAct]; 
00125             K += k;
00126             kSamp++;
00127             break;
00128         case localOnTraceIS:
00129             // Compute importance coefficient, and apply it to the trace.
00130             // Can be larger than 1 if distController action chosen is more likey 
00131             // according to the FPG controller than the combined distribution. A rare event.
00132             // If we get a big reward after this.. then yes, the FPG action should be boosted.
00133             K = distController[sampledAct] / distribution[sampledAct];
00134             //K = sqrt(distController[sampledAct] / distribution[sampledAct]);
00135             controller->setDiscount(K);
00136             controller->discountTrace();
00137             controller->setDiscount(discount);
00138             break;
00139         default:
00140             cout<<"Importance Sampling algorithm not defined !"<<endl;
00141             exit(0);
00142         }
00143         
00144         if (computeGrad) controller->computePartialsAndFeedback(obs, sampledAct);
00145         
00146         Ka = (1 - 1e-2)*Ka + 1e-2*k;
00147     }
00148     
00149     //cout.flush();
00150 }
00151     
00157  void ImportanceSamplingController::getMostProbAction(Observation& obs, Vector& action) { 
00158 
00159      // Very similar to above method...
00160      if (! isTeaching)
00161          controller->getMostProbAction(obs, action);
00162      else {
00163          controller->getAction(obs, action, false);
00164          teacherController->getAction(obs, action);
00165          action.clear();
00166 
00167         controller->reduce(distribution, Approximator::DIST);
00168         teacherController->reduce(teacherDistribution, Approximator::DIST);
00169         distribution *= (1. - tRate);
00170         distribution += tRate*(teacherDistribution);
00171 
00172         // Pick most probable action.
00173         action[0] = 0;
00174         for (size_t i = 1; i < distribution.size(); i++) {
00175             if (distribution[i] > distribution[(int)action[0]]) action[0] = i;
00176         }
00177        
00178     }
00179 
00180 }

00182 
00183 void ImportanceSamplingController::instantStep(Vector& rewards) {
00184     /*if (rewards[0]==0 && K==0)
00185         cout<<"rewards and K are null !\n";*/
00186 
00187     Vector v(rewards.size()); 
00188 
00189     if (!isTeaching)
00190         controller->instantStep(rewards);
00191     else {
00192         switch (whichIS) {
00193         case noIS:
00194         case localOnTraceIS:
00195             controller->instantStep(rewards);
00196             break;
00197         case weightedLocalIS:
00198             K /= kSamp; // Compute averate
00199             v = rewards / K; // Divide by average imporance sampling weight
00200             controller->instantStep(v);
00201             kSamp = 0;
00202             K = 0.0;
00203             break;
00204         default:
00205             cout<<"Importance Sampling algorithm not defined !"<<endl;
00206             exit(0);
00207         }
00208     }
00209 }

00219 void ImportanceSamplingController::setDiscount(double discount) {
00220     this->discount = discount;
00221     controller->setDiscount(discount);
00222 }

00224 void ImportanceSamplingController::resetTrace() { 
00225     //cout<<K<<endl;
00226     K = 0.0;
00227     kSamp = 0;
00228     controller->resetTrace(); 
00229 }

00232 Vector* ImportanceSamplingController::getDistribution() { 
00233     return (&distribution);
00234 }

00237 void ImportanceSamplingController::turnOffTeaching() {
00238     if (isTeaching) {
00239         isTeaching = false;
00240         delete teacher;
00241     }
00242 }
